Review Title: Nice hotel with a (externally caused) catch
Negative Reviews: The hotel is large, and it has one side that is facing a bit more shady area, which should be no problem, since you do not see anything about that when entering the hotel, and it is easy to avoid that area. However, if one's room is facing that street, there is a good chance that you will not sleep because of the very loud music coming from the bar "El Commandante". Several phone calls, they warned the police several times, and then the music goes down a bit, but when the police is gone, the volume goes up again. Officially, they are allowed to have the music until 11 PM, but it lasted at least until 2.30 AM.  Apparently the Romanian police is unable to close the bar, which essentially should happen of course, since they do this more often. The second night this happened, the hotel was fully booked, they could not offer me another room, only the day after they were able to. So, when booking this hotel (for the rest it is definitely worth the experience), make sure your room is not facing the side where "El Commandante" is.
